events.title: Congress passes the Judiciary Act
events.description: The United States Congress passes the Judiciary Act, which establishes the federal judiciary and the Supreme Court as the highest court in the United States.
events.significance: This act laid the foundation for the U.S. federal court system and clarified the jurisdiction of federal courts.

events.title: Civil Rights: Little Rock Nine integrate Central High School
events.description: Nine African American students, known as the Little Rock Nine, enter Central High School in Little Rock, Arkansas, following the Supreme Court's decision to desegregate schools.
events.significance: This event was a significant moment in the American Civil Rights Movement, highlighting the federal government's role in enforcing desegregation.

events.title: Concorde retires from service
events.description: The Concorde, the world's only supersonic passenger airliner, makes its last commercial flight after 27 years of service.
events.significance: The retirement marked the end of the era of supersonic passenger travel.

events.title: Typhoon Haiyan hits the Philippines
events.description: One of the strongest tropical cyclones ever recorded, Typhoon Haiyan, strikes the Philippines causing widespread destruction and thousands of deaths.
events.significance: The typhoon brought attention to the need for improved disaster preparedness and international aid efforts.
